item.title: 空中客车公司首席执行官告诉员工，2024 年年底的状况比预期的要好
item.description: 欧洲空中客车公司（Airbus）首席执行官告诉员工，该集团在2024年底的状况比去年夏天发布利润预警时所担心的要好，但同时警告说，国际环境正在恶化，新增加的业务风险也在增加。【原文：The CEO of Europe's Airbus has told staff that the group ended 2024 in better shape than it feared when issuing a profit warning last summer, while warning of a deteriorating international environment and newly increased business risks.】

item.title: 万科困境考验中国房地产业复兴努力的极限
item.description: 近年来，中国政府采取了许多措施来解决房地产市场的流动性危机，预计最终将重拾旧业，直接出手稳定一家被视为房地产行业风向标的国有开发商。【原文：After numerous measures to resolve a liquidity crisis in the property market in recent years, Beijing is expected to end up dusting off an old playbook and step in directly to stabilise a state-backed developer seen as a bellwether for the sector.】

item.title: 斯坦兰蒂斯称已做好准备适应特朗普的政策变化
item.description: 在美国新总统威胁要对从墨西哥和加拿大进口的商品征收 25% 的关税后，斯泰兰特汽车制造商周二表示，公司已做好充分准备，以适应唐纳德-特朗普宣布的政策变化。【原文：Stellantis is well positioned to adapt to policy changes announced by Donald Trump, the automaker said on Tuesday after the new U.S. president threatened tariffs of 25% on imports from Mexico and Canada.】

item.title: 欧盟冯德莱恩在达沃斯就关税问题发出 "全球竞相抄底 "的警告
item.description: 欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩（Ursula von der Leyen）周二警告说，利用制裁、出口管制和关税等经济手段进行 "全球竞相逐低 "的风险很大。【原文：European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen warned on Tuesday of the risk of a 'global race to the bottom' using economic tools such as sanctions, export controls and tariffs.】

item.title: 特朗普将矛头指向美国海上风电，欧洲企业暴露无遗
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在周一上任的第一天就暂停了新的联邦海上风电租赁项目，以等待环境和经济审查，并称风力发电厂丑陋、昂贵且对野生动物有害。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump in his first day of office on Monday suspended new federal offshore wind leasing pending an environmental and economic review, saying wind mills are ugly, expensive and harm wildlife.】

item.title: 报告称中国奢侈品市场进入 "新常态"，预计 2025 年销量将持平
item.description: 贝恩咨询公司（Bain and Company）在本周二发布的最新《中国奢侈品报告》中表示，中国奢侈品市场将在 2024 年下降 18%至 20%，标志着 "指数增长 "时期的结束，预计今年的销售额将保持持平。【原文：China's luxury market declined by 18% to 20% in 2024, marking the end of a period of "exponential growth", with sales expected to remain flat this year, consultancy Bain and Company said at the launch of its latest 'China Luxury Report' on Tuesday.】

item.title: 关税担忧缓解巩固对欧洲央行下周降息的押注
item.description: 美国新政府没有实施一些人担心的全面贸易关税，欧洲中央银行的决策者们可能松了一口气，下周降息似乎已成定局。【原文：European Central Bank policymakers are likely breathing a sigh of relief that the new U.S. administration did not impose the blanket trade tariffs some had feared and a rate cut next week now seems like a done deal.】

item.title: 文件称三星和 LG 可能将部分家电制造从墨西哥转移到美国
item.description: 据韩国一家报纸周二报道，韩国三星电子和 LG 电子正在考虑将部分家电产品的生产从墨西哥工厂转移到美国工厂。【原文：South Korea's Samsung Electronics and LG Electronics are considering moving some manufacturing of home appliances from their Mexican plants to their U.S. plants, a South Korean newspaper reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国银行称，投资者通过大量股票配置 "让欧洲再次伟大
item.description: 美国博雅全球研究公司（BofA Global Research）周二公布的一份投资者调查报告显示，由于落后的风险资产奋起直追，欧洲股市在 1 月份的配置比例达到四分之一世纪以来的第二高。【原文：European stocks saw their second largest allocation in a quarter of a century in January, as lagging risk assets played catch up, according to a survey of investors from BofA Global Research published on Tuesday.】

item.title: 独家报道：阿美石油公司总裁在达沃斯会议上表示，他预计今年石油需求将增加 130 万桶/日
item.description: 沙特石油巨头阿美石油公司（Aramco）首席执行官阿明-纳赛尔（Amin Nasser）周二表示，他认为石油市场是健康的，并预计今年石油日产量将增加 130 万桶。【原文：Saudi oil giant Aramco's Chief Executive Amin Nasser said on Tuesday he sees the oil market as healthy and expects an additional 1.3 million barrels per day this year.】

item.title: 比特币、美元下滑，等待加密货币总统特朗普的承诺
item.description: 特朗普的第一套政策没有提及资产类别。【原文：Trump's first set of policies made no reference to the asset class.】

item.title: 大众汽车发言人表示，在关税问题上期待与美国政府合作
item.description: 德国汽车制造商大众汽车公司周二表示，期待与美国新政府合作，并强调了对话的重要性，因为人们担心唐纳德-特朗普总统提议的关税会产生影响。【原文：Volkswagen is looking forward to working with the new U.S. administration, the German carmaker said on Tuesday, and stressed the importance of dialogue amid concerns about the impact of tariffs proposed by President Donald Trump.】

item.title: Baillie Gifford 公布最新业绩数据，激进分子争斗加深
item.description: Baillie Gifford U.S. Growth Trust 正在与美国激进分子萨巴资本（Saba Capital）动摇其董事会的计划作斗争，该公司周二公布的最新数据显示，在截至 11 月 30 日的六个月里，按英镑计算，该公司的业绩超过了 S&P 500 指数。【原文：Baillie Gifford U.S. Growth Trust , battling plans by U.S. activist Saba Capital to shake up its board, unveiled fresh data on Tuesday to show it had outperformed the S&P 500 Index in sterling terms in the six months to Nov. 30.】

item.title: 斯坦查特首席执行官：特朗普重返白宫将带来贸易摩擦
item.description: 渣打银行首席执行官比尔-温特斯（Bill Winters）周二在达沃斯世界经济论坛的一次小组会议上表示，随着美国总统唐纳德-特朗普新政府的上台，全球贸易流动将遭遇 "有趣的波动"。【原文：Global trade flows will suffer from "interesting ructions" as the new administration of U.S. President Donald Trump settles in, Standard Chartered CEO Bill Winters said during a panel session at the World Economic Forum in Davos on Tuesday.】

item.title: 俄罗斯财富基金总裁称特朗普可能改变历史
item.description: 俄罗斯价值 230 亿美元的主权财富基金负责人周二赞扬了美国总统唐纳德-特朗普，称他的一系列命令表明，果断的领导力可以改变历史进程、促进增长并带来对话机会。【原文：The head of Russia's $23 billion sovereign wealth fund praised U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday, saying his raft of orders showed that decisive leadership could change the course of history, boost growth and open opportunities for dialogue.】

item.title: 雷诺任命邓肯-明托为新任首席财务官
item.description: 法国汽车制造商雷诺周二表示，已任命邓肯-明托（Duncan Minto）从 3 月 1 日起担任公司首席财务官。【原文：French carmaker Renault said on Tuesday it has appointed Duncan Minto as its Chief Financial Officer, starting from March 1.】

item.title: 在特朗普 2.0 的不确定性下，经济学家对新加坡货币政策看法不一
item.description: 经济学家们对新加坡央行本周是否会放松货币政策或维持货币政策不变以观望美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在其第二个任期内推出的政策意见不一。【原文：Economists are split on whether Singapore's central bank will loosen monetary policy this week or leave its settings unchanged to wait to see what policies U.S. President Donald Trump introduces in his second term.】

item.title: 特朗普就职典礼让全球亿万富豪精英齐聚华盛顿
item.description: 参加美国总统就职典礼的人并不经常与周一在瑞士达沃斯举行的世界富豪年度聚会相似，但在唐纳德-特朗普宣誓就任美国总统时，这些相似之处却很难被忽视。【原文：The attendees at a U.S. presidential inauguration do not often resemble the annual gathering of the world's richest in Davos, Switzerland, which kicked off on Monday, but the parallels were hard to ignore as Donald Trump was sworn in as U.S. President.】

item.title: 早间竞价特朗普回来了，波动性也回来了
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 巴宝莉投资者关注销售好转迹象
item.description: 投资者对巴宝莉寄予厚望，希望该英国奢侈品牌在本周五公布关键节日季的销售报告时，开始显示出扭亏为盈的迹象。【原文：Investors have high hopes for Burberry to start showing signs of progress in its turnaround when the British luxury brand reports sales for the crucial festive season this Friday.】

item.title: 全球企业可能受到特朗普承诺的关税影响
item.description: 美国总统特朗普表示，他可能从2月1日起对加拿大和墨西哥征收25%的关税，这使得多家亚洲汽车制造商和电池公司的股价在周二的交易中走低。【原文：U.S. President Trump said he could impose 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico from Feb. 1, sending shares of several Asian automakers and battery firms lower in trading on Tuesday.】

item.title: 冬季风暴来袭，得克萨斯州港口和飞行员暂停部分作业
item.description: 由于天气寒冷，德克萨斯州的港口和协助船只在港口航行的领航员周一暂停了部分作业。【原文：Texas ports and pilots, who assist in moving vessels around ports, suspended some operations on Monday as frigid weather conditions hit the state.】

item.title: 2020 年签署的中美第一阶段贸易协定是什么？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）已指示联邦机构评估中国在第一阶段贸易协定下的表现。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump has directed federal agencies to assess China's performance under the Phase 1 trade deal that he signed with Beijing in 2020 during his first term at the White House.】

item.title: 特朗普推迟加征关税，中国股市谨慎走高
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的就职政策表明他将通过谈判而不是立即对贸易伙伴征收高额关税，周二中国股市开盘走高，人民币汇率走强。【原文：Chinese stocks opened higher and the yuan strengthened in a cautious start to Tuesday, as U.S. President Donald Trump's inaugural policies suggested he will negotiate rather than immediately impose hefty tariffs on trading partners.】

item.title: 特朗普上台后，亚洲汽车和电池制造商受到冲击
item.description: 周二，日本汽车制造商和韩国电池制造商的股票受到打击，此前美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，他可能很快对加拿大和墨西哥征收关税，并撤销了上届政府关于电动汽车的行政命令。【原文：Shares of Japanese automakers and South Korean battery makers were hit on Tuesday, after U.S. President Donald Trump said he could impose tariffs on Canada and Mexico soon and revoked the previous administration's executive order on electric vehicles.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税计划引发股市和国债波动
item.description: 周二，在唐纳德-特朗普宣布对邻国征收贸易关税的计划后，全球股市和美国国债走势震荡，扭转了盘初唐纳德-特朗普就任新总统后最初几个小时的短暂宽松反弹。【原文：Global shares and U.S. Treasuries were volatile on Tuesday, reversing a brief relief rally from early in the session in the first few hours of Donald Trump's new presidency after he announced plans for trade tariffs on neighbouring countries.】

item.title: 特朗普提出普遍征收关税的想法，但表示美国尚未做好准备
item.description: 美国共和党总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周一提出了普遍征收关税的想法，但表示美国尚未准备好采取这一步骤。【原文：Republican U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday floated the idea of universal tariffs but said the United States was not yet ready for such a step.】

item.title: 特朗普签署承诺的 TikTok 命令，推迟对应用程序的禁令
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一签署命令，推迟对流行短视频应用 TikTok 的禁令，该应用原定于 1 月 19 日关闭。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday signed an order to delay a ban of popular short-video app TikTok that was slated to be shuttered on Jan. 19.】

item.title: 韩国第四季度经济勉强增长；韩国央行将于二月降息：路透调查
item.description: 路透社对经济学家进行的一项调查显示，韩国经济在上个季度几乎没有增长，原因是政治混乱拖累了消费者支出。【原文：The South Korean economy barely grew last quarter as political chaos weighed on consumer spending, according to a Reuters poll of economists who expect the Bank of Korea to cut interest rates next month following a surprise hold last week.】

item.title: 特朗普称考虑对墨西哥和加拿大征收 25% 的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周一表示，他正在考虑对从加拿大和墨西哥进口的商品征收 25% 的关税，因为这两个国家允许许多人以及芬太尼越境。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday said he was thinking of imposing 25% tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico because they were allowing many people to cross the border as well as fentanyl.】
